intro: Hedysarum dededaghense, commonly known as the Dedegah heddysarum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Turkey. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to temperate climates. It plays a role in soil stabilization and provides nectar for pollinators in its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
